DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response used to determine the area of specialized study within the broader practice of medicine and surgery of a physician that directs a patient to an additional source of medical expertise for assistance, examination, information, or treatment.s.

Property.preferredDefinition: Medical Specialty; the branches of medical science that deal with nonsurgical techniques.

Concepts.definition: An area of specialized study within the broader practice of medicine and surgery.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.2.2 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002006. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A medical specialty concerned with the provision of continuing, comprehensive primary health care for the entire family.

Concepts.definition: A medical specialty concerned with the provision of continuing, comprehensive primary health care for the entire family.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Health services that meet most basic health care needs over time. Primary care includes physical exams, treatment of common medical conditions, and preventive care such as immunizations and screenings. Primary care doctors are usually the first health professionals patients see for basic medical care. They may refer a patient to a specialist if needed.: Health services that meet most basic health care needs over time. Primary care includes physical exams, treatment of common medical conditions, and preventive care such as immunizations and screenings. Primary care doctors are usually the first health professionals patients see for basic medical care. They may refer a patient to a specialist if needed.

Concepts.definition: Health services that meet most basic health care needs over time. Primary care includes physical exams, treatment of common medical conditions, and preventive care such as immunizations and screenings. Primary care doctors are usually the first health professionals patients see for basic medical care. They may refer a patient to a specialist if needed.

Health services that meet most basic health care needs over time. Primary care includes physical exams, treatment of common medical conditions, and preventive care such as immunizations and screenings. Primary care doctors are usually the first health professionals patients see for basic medical care. They may refer a patient to a specialist if needed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (on-KOL-o-jist) A doctor who specializes in diagnosing and treating cancer using chemotherapy, hormonal therapy, and biological therapy. A medical oncologist often is the main caretaker of someone who has cancer and coordinates treatment provided by other specialists.

Concepts.definition: A doctor who specializes in treating cancer. Some oncologists specialize in a particular type of cancer treatment. For example, a radiation oncologist specializes in treating cancer with radiation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (GAS-tro-en-ter-AHL-o-jist) A doctor who specializes in diagnosing and treating disorders of the digestive system.

Concepts.definition: A doctor who specializes in diagnosing and treating diseases and disorders of the gastrointestinal tract.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (RAY-dee-OL-o-jist) A doctor who specializes in creating and interpreting pictures of areas inside the body. The pictures are produced with x-rays, sound waves, or other types of energy.

Concepts.definition: A physician who specializes in the diagnostic and/or therapeutic uses of radiation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A physician who treats disease, injury, and deformity by operation or manipulation.

Concepts.definition: A physician who treats disease, injury, and deformity by operation or manipulation that involves gaining access to the patient's body by incisional access.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: crafts, trades, professions, or other means of earning a living (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
